content:
Check:
  #1. check variable type is numeric 2. has suffix DT  3. has date format (look up list?)
  all:
    - name: variable_type   #1
      operator: is_numeric    #type should be avialble from metadata variable_type
    - name: variable_name   #2
      operator: ends_with   
      value: DT
    - name: variable_name   #3
      operator: does_not_use_valid_format_terms
       #need to be able to extract metadata from xpt and read format from unit test data: add row call format under each column 

Core:
  Id: CDISC.ADAMIG.AD0041
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when a variable ends with DT and does not have a date
  format                                                                                 #list of all valid date format available?
Outcome:
  Message: Value of --DT  do not have a date format  #human readable as per guidance then could  define a list of acceptable formats?
  #Output Variables:
   # - --DT 
   #wildcard bing used
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: ADAMIG
        Version: '1.3'
        References:
          - Origin: ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: AD0041
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Document: IG v1.3
                Section: 3.1.2
                Item: '1'
                Cited Guidance: >-
                  Numeric date, time, and datetime variables should be formatted,
                  so as to be human-readable with no loss of precision. 
              - Document: IG v1.3
                Section: 3.1.2
                Item: '2'
                Cited Guidance: >-
                  Variables whose names end in DT are numeric dates.   
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ADLB

json.Description: Raise an error when a variable ends with DT and does not have a date format

Outcome.Message: Value of --DT  do not have a date format

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Numeric date, time, and datetime variables should be formatted, so as to be human-readable with no loss of precision.
Variables whose names end in DT are numeric dates.
